title: Diarrhea and stomachaches plagued Roman soldiers stationed at Hadrian's Wall, discovery of microscopic parasites finds
summary: Analysis of latrine sediments at the Roman fort of Vindolanda has revealed that at least three parasites were widespread among Roman soldiers.

title: Comet 3I/ATLAS reaches its closest point to Earth tonight: How to see it in the sky and online
summary: Comet 3I/ATLAS, the third interstellar object ever detected, will swing closest to Earth overnight from Thursday to Friday (Dec. 18 to 19). Here’s how to see it.

title: NASA eyes 3I/ATLAS with alien-hunting Clipper spacecraft as comet approaches Earth
summary: NASA's alien-hunting Europa Clipper spacecraft took seven hours of ultraviolet observations of interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS while both objects zoom toward Jupiter.

title: Undersea lava rubble acts as a 'sponge' for carbon dioxide, study finds
summary: Lava rubble at the bottom of the sea is acting like a giant "sponge" for carbon dioxide, ancient cores reveal.

title: Rare 1,300-year-old medallion decorated with menorahs found near Jerusalem's Temple Mount
summary: An excavation at the City of David in Jerusalem unearthed a 1,300-year-old medallion decorated with a seven-branched menorah on each side.

title: NASA's Parker Solar Probe mapped an unseen part of the sun at its most active moment
summary: Data from NASA's Parker Solar Probe has enabled astronomers to map the unssen surface of the sun's atmosphere for the first time.

title: Mysterious, irradiated 'scar' in our galaxy points to 2 stars that almost hit the sun
summary: Astronomers traced a mysterious 'scar' of ionized gas around the solar system to two stars that had a close flyby with our sun millions of years ago.

title: Pumas in Patagonia started feasting on penguins — but now they're behaving strangely, a new study finds
summary: Pumas in Patagonia, Argentina are eating penguins in a national park — and it's changing how the big cats are interacting with each other.

title: Spiders on Jupiter? Scientists uncover secret origins of arachnid-like 'demon' lurking on gas giant's moon.
summary: A new study reveals the likely origin of a mysterious spider-like pattern first spotted on Jupiter's moon Europa in 1998. The finding could have implications for a NASA spacecraft en route to the frozen world.

title: Detectorists find Anglo-Saxon treasure hoard that may have been part of a 'ritual killing'
summary: These Anglo-Saxon accessories were recovered from the side of a hill in England and may be from a hoard, a ritual deposit or a collection of stolen items.

title: James Webb telescope finds supermassive black hole hidden inside 'Jekyll and Hyde' galaxy
summary: The discovery of a hidden supermassive black hole inside an ancient galaxy suggests that some of our universe's most extreme objects could be invisible unless observed in infrared wavelengths, James Webb telescope observations reveal.

title: How to Watch the Final Meteor Shower of 2025
summary: Conditions in the US should be perfect for the final meteor shower of 2025, with no moonlight present to interfere with spotting shooting stars.

title: Pompeii victims were wearing woolen cloaks in August when they died — but experts are split on what that means
summary: Some of the victims at Pompeii were wearing woolen cloaks when they died, even though it was August, new research finds.

title: تعرف عليهم.. 4 أفلام عربية مرشحة لجائزة الأوسكار
summary: في سابقة تاريخية، دخلت 4 أفلام عربية سباق المنافسة على جائزة أوسكار أفضل فيلم دولي، التي تمنحها سنويا أكاديمية علوم وفنون السينما الأميركية للأعمال المنتَجة خارج الولايات المتحدة.

title: Therabody Promo Codes: 50% Off | December 2025
summary: Save on the science-backed devices you’ve been eyeing with 15% off Theragun discount code and 50% off other great deals.

title: Ancient Egyptian valley temple excavated — and it's connected to a massive upper temple dedicated to the sun god, Ra
summary: The newly excavated 4,500-year-old valley temple from ancient Egypt holds a "public calendar" and a roof for astronomical observation.

title: Polar bears in southern Greenland are 'using jumping genes to rapidly rewrite their own DNA' to survive melting sea ice
summary: Warming temperatures appear to be driving genetic mutations in some polar bears to help them survive the shifting climatic conditions.

title: Deep snow blanket transforms Yellowstone Lake into a giant white void — Earth from space
summary: A 2022 astronaut photo shows a thick blanket of snow covering Yellowstone Lake, transforming the frozen body of water into a featureless white void. But below the ice lie some of Earth's hottest hydrothermal vents.

title: 30 models of the universe proved wrong by final data from groundbreaking cosmology telescope
summary: The Atacama Cosmology Telescope (ACT) in Chile has released its final batch of data after 15 years — and it proves that the Hubble tension, a rift in our understanding of the universe, is very real.

title: 5,000-year-old dog skeleton and dagger buried together in Swedish bog hint at mysterious Stone Age ritual
summary: Five millennia ago, ancient fishers buried a dog alongside a dagger in a lake bed. Archaeologists are trying to figure out why.

title: Magdala stone: 2,000-year-old carving from Jerusalem is world's oldest known depiction of a menorah
summary: A pilgrim who visited the Second Temple in Jerusalem may have carved their memories into a limestone block for another synagogue.

title: 'This has re-written our understanding of Roman concrete manufacture': Abandoned Pompeii worksite reveal how self-healing concrete was made
summary: The discovery of a 2,000-year-old building site in Pompeii reveals the raw ingredients for ancient Roman self-healing concrete.

title: Scientists finally sequence the vampire squid's huge genome, revealing secrets of the 'living fossil'
summary: The genetic link between squids and octopuses may just be found in the vampire squid genome.

title: Can a turtle tuck its head all the way inside its shell?
summary: Turtle shells evolved over the course of 300 million years, but self-defense wasn't the initial driver, researchers think.

title: Science history: Norwegian explorer wins the treacherous race to the South Pole, while British rival perishes along with his crew — Dec. 14, 1911
summary: In December 1911, Roald Amundsen and his crew reached the South Pole, beating his rival, Robert Falcon Scott, by 35 days. Scott and his crew didn't survive the return trip.

title: 16th-century gallows and dozens of skeletons discovered in France
summary: Archaeologists have identified a 16th-century gallows structure and nearly a dozen mass burial pits in Grenoble, France.

title: إدراج "الكشري المصري" في قائمة "اليونسكو" للتراث
summary: أعلنت منظمة الأمم المتحدة للتربية والعلوم والثقافة (اليونسكو) إدراج "الكشري المصري" على القائمة التمثيلية للتراث الثقافي غير المادي للإنسانية لعام 2025.

title: "الكشري" على رادار اليونسكو.. لماذا طلبت مصر تسجيله رسميا؟
summary: يترقب المصريون حصول "الكشري المصري" على اعتماد منظمة اليونسكو لإدراجه ضمن قائمة التراث الثقافي غير المادي لعام 2025، خلال اجتماع المنظمة المنعقد في العاصمة الهندية نيودلهي، حيث تبحث عشرات الترشيحات المقدمة من 78 دولة.

title: بعد 3 أيام من اختفائه.. إنقاذ طفل سوري دفن حيا في تركيا
summary: أفادت وسائل إعلام تركية بعثور فرق البحث والإنقاذ في ولاية هاتاي على طفل سوري بعد اختفائه يوم الجمعة الماضية، حيث ضربه خاله على رأسه بحجر، وقام بدفنه.

title: زلزال بقوة 6.36 درجة يضرب اليونان ويصل تركيا وإيطاليا
summary: قال المركز الألماني لأبحاث علوم الأرض (جي.إف.زد) اليوم السبت إن زلزالا بقوة 6.36 درجة ضرب اليونان.

title: صور وفيديو.. هيكل "ريشات" المذهل في صحراء موريتانيا
summary: هيكل جيولوجي مذهل عمره لا يقل عن 100 مليون عام.. أشبه بعين حمراء أو عين ثور يمكن رؤيته من الفضاء.
